availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip D. Yeiser (Paducah attorney and claims agent)

body.p: Paducah, Kwntucky attorney, claims agent, and Commonwealth’s Attorney. Lancaster native. Married Ellen Deerham. Father of David A. Yeiser. First Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney from 1862 to 1864.

bibl.p: Memorial Record of Western Kentucky, Volume II (Chicago, IL: Lewis Publishing Company, 1904), p. 527. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 2, p. 358. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 100. U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1864, Collection District 1, Division 15, Paducah. “Phillip D. Yeiser,” Find A Grave, February 5, 2012, memorial no. 84527974 (accessed March 23, 2017). William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1866), p. 10.
